# The `LoopVersioning` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class emits a version of the loop where run-time checks ensure that may-alias pointers can&#39;t overlap. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::LoopVersioning</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This class emits a version of the loop where run-time checks ensure that may-alias pointers can&#39;t overlap.

It currently only supports single-exit loops and assumes that the loop already has a preheader.

Definition at line 41 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/loopversioning-h">LoopVersioning.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Constructors

### LoopVersioning() {#ab781d1d60b8dba236c33dba9ae54e087}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LoopVersioning::LoopVersioning (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopaccessinfo">LoopAccessInfo</a> &amp; LAI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a12b6596f3de8ec2382209b04c2b5444c">RuntimePointerCheck</a> &gt; Checks, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfo">LoopInfo</a> &#42; LI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dominatortree">DominatorTree</a> &#42; DT, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &#42; SE)</>}>
Expects <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopaccessinfo">LoopAccessInfo</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfo">LoopInfo</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dominatortree">DominatorTree</a> as input.

It uses runtime check provided by the user. If <code>UseLAIChecks</code> is true, we will retain the default checks made by LAI. Otherwise, construct an object having no checks and we expect the user to add them.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/loopversioning-h/#l00047">47</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/loopversioning-h">LoopVersioning.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/loopversioning-cpp/#l00042">42</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/loopversioning-cpp">LoopVersioning.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Functions

### annotateInstWithNoAlias() {#a5da1dcc92515b7cdd28ce936d6488964}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LoopVersioning::annotateInstWithNoAlias (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; VersionedInst, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; OrigInst)</>}>
Add the noalias annotations to <code>VersionedInst</code>.

<code>OrigInst</code> is the instruction corresponding to <code>VersionedInst</code> in the original loop. Initialize the aliasing scopes with prepareNoAliasMetadata once before this can be called.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/loopversioning-h/#l00095">95</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/loopversioning-h">LoopVersioning.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/loopversioning-cpp/#l00228">228</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/loopversioning-cpp">LoopVersioning.cpp</a>.

### annotateLoopWithNoAlias() {#a080fd063ce509a69475d5f80e8b2d973}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void LoopVersioning::annotateLoopWithNoAlias ()">
Annotate memory instructions in the versioned loop with no-alias metadata based on the memchecks issued.

This is just wrapper that calls prepareNoAliasMetadata and annotateInstWithNoAlias on the instructions of the versioned loop.

### getNonVersionedLoop() {#afc32c640645a5caeb9fe788699d4f75b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Loop &#42; llvm::LoopVersioning::getNonVersionedLoop ()</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the fall-back loop.

Control flows here if pointers in the loop may alias (i.e. one of the memchecks failed).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/loopversioning-h/#l00077">77</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/loopversioning-h">LoopVersioning.h</a>.

### getVersionedLoop() {#a296de170be5a983234de7d53da3c1635}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Loop &#42; llvm::LoopVersioning::getVersionedLoop ()</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the versioned loop.

Control flows here if pointers in the loop don&#39;t alias (i.e. all memchecks passed). (This loop is actually the same as the original loop that we got constructed with.)

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/loopversioning-h/#l00073">73</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/loopversioning-h">LoopVersioning.h</a>.

<MemberDefinition

This needs to be called before the first call to annotateInstWithNoAlias.

### versionLoop() {#a65b5f9f4aa48ceb121d65679d8b1a689}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::LoopVersioning::versionLoop ()"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Performs the CFG manipulation part of versioning the loop including the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dominatortree">DominatorTree</a> and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfo">LoopInfo</a> updates.

The loop that was used to construct the class will be the &quot;versioned&quot; loop i.e. the loop that will receive control if all the memchecks pass.

This allows the loop transform pass to operate on the same loop regardless of whether versioning was necessary or not:

for each loop L: analyze L if versioning is necessary version L transform L

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/loopversioning-h/#l00064">64</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/loopversioning-h">LoopVersioning.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### versionLoop() {#a81c8a5368d02d0b52654a3efe83dec38}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LoopVersioning::versionLoop (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; &gt; &amp; DefsUsedOutside)</>}>
Same but if the client has already precomputed the set of values used outside the loop, this API will allows passing that.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/loopversioning-h/#l00068">68</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/loopversioning-h">LoopVersioning.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/loopversioning-cpp/#l00049">49</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/loopversioning-cpp">LoopVersioning.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### addPHINodes() {#a4222829ce92822b035c2da4c4b2f2301}

<MemberDefinition

Adds the necessary PHI nodes for the versioned loops based on the loop-defined values used outside of the loop.

This needs to be called after versionLoop if there are defs in the loop that are used outside the loop.

### GroupToScope {#a62da41fe0b736e8a5bef056059bd90b5}

<MemberDefinition

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Loop&#42; llvm::LoopVersioning::NonVersionedLoop = nullptr</>}>
The fall-back loop.

I.e. control flows here if pointers in the loop may alias (memchecks failed).
